subject: Economics
title: Nigerian Economic Systems and Examples

traditional_economy.description: Many Nigerian rural communities still operate traditional economies based on subsistence farming and barter systems.
traditional_economy.modern_context: Integration with cash economy through mobile banking and commodity exchanges

informal_sector.description: Over 60% of Nigerian workforce in informal sector, crucial for economic understanding.
examples: Okada (motorcycle taxi) business in urban areas
informal_sector.economic_impact: Contributes significantly to GDP but often not captured in official statistics

oil_economy.description: Nigeria's economy heavily dependent on oil exports, creating 'Dutch disease' effects.
oil_economy.policy_discussions: Debates around diversification and resource curse

case_studies.title: Impact of Fuel Subsidy Removal on Lagos Households
case_studies.data: 2012 subsidy removal increased transport costs by 300%, affecting low-income families
case_studies.analysis: Demonstrates price elasticity of demand in real Nigerian context

case_studies.title: Naira Devaluation and Import Dependency
case_studies.data: 2016 devaluation made imported goods 50% more expensive
case_studies.analysis: Shows balance of payments and exchange rate effects

nigerian_context: Economics curriculum should reflect Nigeria's mixed economy with traditional, informal, and formal sectors.

subject: Geography
title: Nigerian Geographical Features and Human Impact

physical_features.niger_river: Major waterway influencing settlement patterns and transportation
physical_features.niger_delta: Oil-rich wetland ecosystem facing environmental degradation
physical_features.jos_plateau: Tin mining region with unique climate and vegetation

human_geography.urbanization: Lagos growing by 500,000 people annually, creating megacity challenges
human_geography.rural_urban_migration: Movement from Northern states to Southern cities for economic opportunities
human_geography.ethnic_diversity: 250+ ethnic groups influencing settlement patterns and cultural landscapes

environmental_issues.soil_erosion: Severe in Southeastern Nigeria due to deforestation
environmental_issues.flooding: Annual floods in Niger Delta and Lagos affecting millions

case_studies.title: Lagos Megacity Development
case_studies.data: Population 25 million, GDP contribution 30% of national total
case_studies.analysis: Urban geography concepts: site, situation, function, morphology

case_studies.title: Niger Delta Environmental Crisis
case_studies.data: Over 50 million barrels of oil spilled since 1950s
case_studies.analysis: Human impact on physical geography and sustainable development

nigerian_context: Geography education must address Nigeria-specific challenges like climate change adaptation and sustainable resource management.

subject: English Language/Literature
title: Nigerian Literature and Cultural Context

oral_tradition.description: Rich tradition of storytelling, proverbs, and folk tales in all Nigerian languages
oral_tradition.literary_value: Influences modern Nigerian literature and provides cultural depth

colonial_literature.description: Literature responding to British colonial experience
key_works: Things Fall Apart by Chinua Achebe
There Was a Country by Chinua Achebe

contemporary_literature.description: Modern Nigerian writers addressing current issues

case_studies.title: Analysis of Things Fall Apart
case_studies.cultural_elements: Igbo customs, British colonialism, traditional vs modern values
case_studies.teaching_approach: Compare with student's own cultural experiences

case_studies.title: Pidgin English in Nigerian Literature
case_studies.examples: Works by Ken Saro-Wiwa, contemporary plays and novels
case_studies.linguistic_value: Reflects authentic Nigerian voice and multilingual reality

nigerian_context: Literature curriculum should celebrate Nigerian voices and address universal themes through local cultural lenses.

subject: All Subjects
title: Pidgin English Explanations for Complex Concepts

science_concepts.photosynthesis: How plants dey use sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to produce food and oxygen. Na like say plant dey cook food with sun as stove.
science_concepts.gravity: Force wey dey pull everything down to earth. Na why ball wey you throw up dey always fall down - earth dey hold am tight.
science_concepts.chemical_reaction: When different substances mix and change to form new things. Like when you mix cement and water, e become concrete.

mathematics_concepts.algebra: Using letters to represent numbers in equations. Instead of saying 'some number plus 5 equals 10', you write x + 5 = 10.
mathematics_concepts.probability: Chance of something happening. Like when you toss coin, probability to get head na 1 out of 2, or 50% chance.
mathematics_concepts.statistics: Way to collect and analyze numbers to find patterns. Like counting how many cars pass your street to know traffic.

social_science_concepts.democracy: System where people choose their leaders through voting. Na like family meeting where everybody get chance to talk and vote.
social_science_concepts.inflation: When money lose value and prices dey increase. Na why your pocket money buy less things than before.
social_science_concepts.globalization: How countries dey connect and affect each other. Like how Nollywood movies dey popular for foreign countries.

usage_guidelines: Use Pidgin to explain difficult concepts, then transition to standard English. Include both versions in learning materials.
regional_variations: Adapt Pidgin explanations for different regions - Lagos slang vs Port Harcourt vs Kano variations.

subject: All Subjects
title: Multilingual Glossary: Hausa, Yoruba, Igbo Terms
features: Pronunciation guides, audio clips, visual representations. Searchable by English or local language.
educational_benefit: Helps students connect curriculum to their linguistic heritage and improves comprehension.

subject: Economics/Geography
title: State-Specific Economic and Environmental Data

lagos_state.economic_profile: Contributes 30% of Nigeria's GDP, major port and financial hub

kano_state.economic_profile: Agricultural powerhouse, textile industry, groundnut production

rivers_state.economic_profile: Oil and gas hub, major contributor to national revenue

abia_state.economic_profile: Industrial hub known as 'Japan of Africa'

data_visualization: Interactive maps showing economic indicators, population density, and development indices by state.
teaching_applications: Compare economic development across states, analyze regional disparities, discuss federal allocation principles.

subject: Social Studies
title: Real-World Case Studies with Nigerian Examples

conflict_resolution.description: Conflict between oil companies, government, and local communities over resource control and environmental damage
conflict_resolution.current_status: Amnesty program, UNEP cleanup, ongoing development challenges

community_development.description: Women-led agricultural cooperative transforming local economy through cassava processing
community_development.impact: Increased household incomes, reduced poverty, inspired similar initiatives nationwide

technological_innovation.description: From 2010s startup boom creating unicorns like Flutterwave and Paystack
technological_innovation.global_impact: Positioning Nigeria as African tech leader, creating jobs for young graduates

discussion_questions: How do these Nigerian examples illustrate broader social science concepts? What solutions can students propose?
extension_activities: Research similar cases in student's local community, create action plans for local issues.
